conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process of the ideal gas to calculate work done.
p-V diagram shows cyclic process from A to B to C and back to A; pressure in 10^5 Pa, volume in liters.
Work done is integral of pressure with respect to volume; use ideal gas law pV = nRT.
Work done for A→B is 0 because process is isothermal.
Work done for B→C is 0 because process is isothermal.
Work done for C→A is 0 because process is isothermal.
